name: ishlangu-iklwa (combined)
description: this is a replica of a 'paired' variant of the Kulu spear-and-shield, 'ishlangu and iklwa, this particular specimen is a medium-sized spear attatched to a mantle on the inner frame of the long, lacquer-wood shield. Although weighty, it has the benefit having the reach of a spear and the protective qaulities of a spear it can be thrusted either with one or two hands making it an excellent duaeling weapon.

name: ishlangu-iklwa (combined)
description: This is a full replica of the kusarigama, this particurly model bares chains with flaired, bladed edges and the weight is now a small mace-head with flaying-ridges. Rip and tear. Might want to wear some leather-gloves.
